com.swirlds.platform

Class Statistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swirlds.platform.Statistics

  • public class Statistics
extends java.lang.Object
    This class collects and reports various statistics about network operation. A statistic such as Transactions Per Second can be retrieved by using its name "trans/sec". The current list of statistic names can be found by calling getAvailableStats, and includes the following:
    • time - the current time
    • trans - number of transactions received so far
    • secR2C - time from receiving an event to knowing its consensus (in seconds)
    • secC2C - time from creating an event to knowing its consensus (in seconds)
    • sec/sync - duration of average successful sync (in seconds)
    • sec/round - duration of average round in seconds (chart is rounds/sec)
    • ping - average time for a round trip message between 2 computers (in milliseconds)
    • bytes/sec - number of bytes in the transactions received per second (from unique events created by self and others)
    • trans/sec - number of transactions received per second (from unique events created by self and others)
    • events/sec - number of unique events received per second (created by self and others)
    • dupEv/sec - number of events received per second that are already known
    • dupEv% - percentage of events received that are already known (chart is this/100)
    • badEv/sec - number of corrupted events received per second
    • cSync/sec - (call syncs) syncs completed per second initiated by this member
    • rSync/sec - (receive syncs) syncs completed per second initiated by other member
    • icSync/sec - (interrupted call syncs) syncs interrupted per second initiated by this member
    • irSync/sec - (interrupted receive syncs) syncs interrupted per second initiated by other member
    • freeB - bytes of free memory (which can increase after a garbage collection)
    • totB - total bytes in the Java Virtual Machine
    • maxB - maximum bytes that the JVM might use
    • proc - number of processors (cores) available to the JVM
    • name - name of this member
    • ID - ID number of this member
    • members - total number of members participating
    • local - number of members running on this local machine
    • write - the app claimed to log statistics every this many milliseconds
    • bytes/trans - number of bytes in each transactions
    • trans/event - number of transactions in each event
    • simCallSyncs - max number of syncs this can initiate simultaneously
    • dedup - avoid duplicates: a list of event counts is sent every this many events (0=never)
    • cEvents/sec - number of events per second created by this node
    • secC2R - time from a created event from another member to it being received and veryfing the signature (in seconds)
    • secC2RC - time from a created event from another member to it being received and and having consensus for it (in seconds)
    • secR2nR - time from an event received in one round, to an event received in the next round (in seconds)
    • secR2F - time from a round's first received event to all the famous witnesses being known (in seconds)
    • q1 - number of non-consensus events in queue waiting to be handled
    • q2 - number of consensus events in queue waiting to be handled
    • q3 - number of handled events in queue waiting to be deleted
    • roundSup - latest round with state signed by a supermajority
    • ev/sync - number of events sent per successful sync
    • time - the current time
    • trans - number of transactions received so far
    • secR2C - time from receiving an event to knowing its consensus (in seconds)
    • secC2C - time from creating an event to knowing its consensus (in seconds)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Statistics

        public Statistics(Platform platform)
        Constructor for a Statistics object that will monitor the statistics for the network for the given Platform.
        Parameters:
        platform - the Platform whose statistics should be monitored

    • Method Detail

      • getPingSeconds

        public double[] getPingSeconds()
        Returns the time for a round-trip message to each member (in seconds).

        This is an exponentially-weighted average of recent ping times.

        Returns:
        the average times, for each member, in seconds

      • setStatsWritePeriod

        public void setStatsWritePeriod(int writePeriod)
        An app can call this to record how often it plans to save statistics to disk. This statistic isn't actually used by the system, but if all the stats are written out, then this will be one of them, so it will be recorded with the rest.
        Parameters:
        writePeriod - number of milliseconds between writes

      • getAvailableStats

        public java.lang.String[][] getAvailableStats()
        Returns an array of available statistic entries that describe how the network is currently operating. Each statistic entry is an array of strings:
        • name - used to retrieve the statistics. And useful for showing concise tables
        • description - a short description of what the statistic means
        • format - a default format string, such as "%8.3f" for an 3-digit double with 3 decimal places
        Returns:
        the array of statistic entries.

      • getNumStats

        public int getNumStats()
        Get the number of different statistics that can be retrieved by getStat().
        Returns:
        number of different statistics that can be retrieved by getStat().

      • getStat

        public double getStat(java.lang.String statName)
        Returns a statistic about how the network is running, given its name. The names can be obtained with getAvailableStats. Most statistics are doubles. If the statistic is an integer, then it is casted to a double. If the statistic is a string, then -1.0 is returned. The actual type of a statistic can be seen from the last letter of the default formatter getAvailableStats()[2].
        Parameters:
        statName - the name of the statistic (call getAvailableStats to see the possible choices)
        Returns:
        the statistic

      • getStat

        public double getStat(int index)
        Returns a statistic about how the network is running, given its index in the array returned by getAvailableStats. Most statistics are doubles. If the statistic is an integer, then it is casted to a double. If the statistic is a string, then -1.0 is returned. The actual type of a statistic can be seen from the last letter of the default formatter getAvailableStats()[2].
        Parameters:
        index - index of the statistic in the list returned by getAvailableStats
        Returns:
        the statistic

      • getAllHistory

        public com.swirlds.platform.StatsBuffer getAllHistory(java.lang.String statName)
        return a StatsBuffer for the entire history of the given statistic, or null if there is none
        Parameters:
        statName - the name of the statistic to get
        Returns:
        the StatsBuffer, or null if there is no statistic for that name, or there is one but it doesn't keep a history

      • getRecentHistory

        public com.swirlds.platform.StatsBuffer getRecentHistory(java.lang.String statName)
        return a StatsBuffer for the recent history of the given statistic, or null if there is none
        Parameters:
        statName - the name of the statistic to get
        Returns:
        the StatsBuffer, or null if there is no statistic for that name, or there is one but it doesn't keep a history

      • getStatString

        public java.lang.String getStatString(java.lang.String statName)
        Returns a string representation of a statistic about how the network is running, given its name. The names can be obtained with getAvailableStats. The statistic is converted to a String using the default format (right justified, spaces on the left), or "" if the name is invalid
        Parameters:
        statName - the name of the statistic (call getAvailableStats to see the possible choices)
        Returns:
        the statistic converted to a string

      • getStatIndex

        public int getStatIndex(java.lang.String statName)
        Get the index number of a statistic, which can be passed to methods like getStat(). It is equivalent (and often easier) to just pass the name directly to getStat(). But this method also is provided, for completeness.
        Parameters:
        statName - the name of the statistic
        Returns:
        the index, or -1 if that name doesn't match any statistic

      • getStatString

        public java.lang.String getStatString(int index)
        Returns a string representation of a statistic about how the network is running, given its index in the array returned by getAvailableStats. The statistic is converted to a String using the default format (right justified, spaces on the left), or "" if the name is invalid
        Parameters:
        index - index of the statistic in the array returned by getAvailableStats
        Returns:
        the statistic converted to a string
